text: Getting another program's output as input on the fly
I've two programs I'm using in this way:
c_program prints something using printf() and python_program.py reads using sys.stdin.readline()
I'd like to make the python_program.py process c_program's output as it prints, immediately, so that it can print its own current output.
Unfortunately python_program.py gets its input only after c_program ends.
